title: 15 Classic Casseroles for Sunday Dinner
description: These old-fashioned casseroles bring the whole meal together in a single baking dish for slice-and-serve ease.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE 15 Sunday Dinner Casseroles So Good You'll Look Forward to Them All Week By Hannah Klinger Hannah Klinger Hannah Klinger is a writer, editor, and content manager at Savory Magazine. She has a passion for helping home cooks build their confidence in the kitchen with hacks, how-tos, and guides to inspire them to try something new. She's contributed to America's Test Kitchen, Cooking Light, Food & Wine, EatingWell, and more. Allrecipes' editorial guidelines Published on March 20, 2020 Close Credits: Allrecipes Magazine Sunday dinners are usually a labor of love — the kind of slow-cooked, pure comfort meal that finishes out a relaxing weekend and gives you a boost for the week ahead. These casseroles bring the whole meal together in a single baking dish for slice-and-serve ease. Brunchers will love breakfast-themed bakes with eggs, hash browns, and cheese. Layered casseroles in Italian and Mexican flavors will also please your family. And since the classics are still at the top of any favorites list, there's the requisite Chicken Divan, Tuna Noodle, and Tamale Pie. Just a few reasons why Sunday dinner is still our favorite meal of the week. 01 of 15 World's Best Lasagna View Recipe Save Bobby Emrick If you're Italian-American, Sunday supper isn't complete without lasagna. If not, you should make it a new tradition. This sausage and beef version has over 18,000 fans and counting. 02 of 15 Layered Chicken and Black Bean Enchiladas View Recipe Save Angela F. Instead of filling and rolling each enchilada, treat tortillas like lasagna noodles and layer them between the sauce, chicken, black beans, and cheese. It's brilliant, fast, and delicious. 03 of 15 A Scotsman's Shepherd Pie View Recipe Save CrickettP Creator Larry Short simmers ground lamb in a stout gravy before layering it in a casserole dish with mashed potatoes. The result is hearty, packed with flavor, and truly unique. "This recipe blows away all others for Shepherd's pie," says don33taw. 04 of 15 Country Breakfast Casserole View Recipe Save YearnfortheBurn Whether you're brunching on Sunday or craving breakfast for dinner, this bake will hit the spot. All your morning favorites come together in one casserole dish. "It got rave reviews and my mother-in-law left with the recipe!" says TVChick. See More: Breakfast and Brunch Casseroles 05 of 15 Pizza Casserole View Recipe Save *Sherri* Swap your pizza dough for egg noodles and your pizza pan for a baking dish, and you get this clever casserole mashup. Follow the lead of many reviewers and switch up the stir-ins just like toppings on a pie. 06 of 15 Tater Tot Taco Casserole View Recipe Save HeatherH Any Midwesterner will tell you that tater tots simply belong in a casserole. This taco-inspired version uses taco seasoning, Mexican-blend cheese, and enchilada sauce. "My family loved it," says cooker lady. 07 of 15 Chicken Divan Casserole View Recipe Save Chef DJ The classic creamy broccoli and chicken casserole gets a low-carb twist (and extra veggies!) with riced cauliflower in place of rice or pasta. "This recipe was such a standout I know we will be having it regularly," says Walter Dervin. 08 of 15 Carol's Baked Ziti Casserole View Recipe Save Molly Ricotta, Parmesan, and mozzarella make this noodle bake extra cheesy and comforting. Stick to this vegetarian version, or do as many reviewers and stir in browned beef or sausage. "My dad could not stop eating it," says Nikki F. 09 of 15 Chicken and Biscuit Casserole View Recipe Save Snack in the Kitchen Classic chicken pot pie is even easier in the casserole dish with flaky biscuits on top instead of a pie crust. "This is the epitome of downright, in the pit of your soul comfort food! Definitely worth the effort!" says Saranayd. 10 of 15 Turkey Tetrazzini II View Recipe Save Amanda A homemade creamy mushroom sauce blankets the egg noodles, turkey, and peas in this American classic. It bakes with a Parm and breadcrumb topper until golden. "I made a large batch of this and boy did it disappear," says Sadie. Grandma's Favorite Comfort Food Recipes 11 of 15 Farmer's Casserole View Recipe Save Monkeymommy We love an assemble-and-bake casserole, but one that can come together the night before? Genius. This breakfast-inspired version with hash browns, ham, and pepper jack cheese would be delicious at any meal. 12 of 15 Hot Tamale Pie View Recipe Save Dave Thompson This southwestern classic might remind you of Shepherd's Pie, but with a Tex-Mex spin. Cornbread batter tops a layer of beef sautéed with salsa and spices. The two layers meld in the oven as the cornbread bakes. Extra cheese makes it even better. See More: 15 Casseroles That Start With a Box of Cornbread Mix 13 of 15 Best Tuna Casserole View Recipe Save Mackenzie Schieck Retro classics like tuna noodle casserole are mainstays for a reason... they are nostalgia on a plate. This version does right by every detail, including the must-have potato chip topping. "I LOVE this recipe," says Elizabeth. 14 of 15 Pastitsio II View Recipe Save Rob Curtis Leave it to the Greeks to invent a noodle bake that would make any baked ziti jealous. Here, a slow-simmered meat sauce is tossed with the pasta, then topped with a rich béchamel sauce before baking. 15 of 15 Mexican Quesadilla Casserole View Recipe Save Allrecipes Magazine Another take on the Mexican-style lasagna has everything we love — beef, beans, green chilis, tortillas, and Cheddar — all in one casserole dish. "The whole family, from grandparents to toddlers, loved this," says Chrystine Warden Dimitry. Explore more: Recipes Main Dishes Casserole Recipes Was this page helpful? Thanks for your feedback! Tell us why!
